channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Planning guide to move to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan, design, implement, adopt, and move to Microsoft Intune. Get guidance and advice to determine goals, use-case scenarios and requirements, and create rollout and communication plans, support, testing, and validation plans.

item.title: Migration guide to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deployment guide to set up, onboard, or move to Intune. These steps include moving from partner MDM providers, using co-management, moving from on-premises group policy, and moving from Office 365 device management.

item.title: What is device management? - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about what device management means and how it can help organizations, including Microsoft 365 small & medium business, and enterprise. See a list of features and benefits, including mobile device management (MDM) and mobile application management (MAM), and learn about Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Endpoint management services and solutions at Microsoft - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune is a family of on-premises products and cloud services. It includes Intune, Configuration Manager, co-management, Endpoint Analytics, Windows Autopilot, and the admin center to manage cloud devices and on on-premises.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Using Windows virtual machines with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the general guidelines for using Windows 10/11 virtual machines with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Deployment guide for Windows device management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Windows device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Protect devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Intune capabilities that can help you protect your devices and data against unauthorized access and other threats.

item.title: Microsoft Intune servicing information and details - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the frequency of the Microsoft Intune service updates, the release cadence, and how to check your tenant release version.

item.title: Privacy and personal data in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn what personal data is collected and processed in Intune.

item.title: Get started with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See an overview of the steps to start using Intune. Plan your move and deployment of Intune, determine your licensing needs and any platform requirements, use compliance and Conditional Access, deploy apps, create device configuration profiles, and enroll your devices to be managed. Get more information on mobile application management for BYOD or personal devices.

item.title: View device details with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View your device details, including operating systems, storage space, manufacturer, and model. Get a list of installed apps, check compliance policies, and set up TeamViewer with Microsoft Intune in Azure. Similar to viewing inventory of the devices you manage.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: A guide to managing iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add users to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add and managing Microsoft Entra user accounts from within Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deployment guide for Linux device management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use our platform deployment guide to set up Linux device management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: What is Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune manages users and devices, simplifies app management and automated policy deployment, and integrates with mobile threat defense. It connects to Managed Google Play, Apple tokens and certificates, and Teamviewer for remote assistance. Can use MDM or MAM to protect data, configure devices, and simplify access to company resources.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, administrative templates (ADMX), and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Centrally manage Admin Tasks - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Centrally manage admin tasks in Microsoft Intune. Use the unified Admin tasks view to organize and act on administrative tasks from Device Offboarding, Endpoint Privilege Management, and more.

item.title: Enable Mobile Threat Defense connector in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable the connector between your Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) partner and Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Frequently asked questions for Endpoint Privilege Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: A list of frequently asked questions for customers deploying Microsoft Intune Endpoint Privilege Management

item.title: Use OEMConfig on Android Enterprise devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage and use devices running Android Enterprise with OEMConfig. See all the steps, including an overview, see the prerequisites, create the configuration profile in Intune, and see a list of supported OEMConfig apps.

item.title: Mobile Threat Defense with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) with your Mobile Threat Defense partner to protect access to company resources based on device risk.

item.title: Plan and Prepare for Endpoint Privilege Management Deployment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan your Endpoint Privilege Management deploying by understanding requirements, fundamentals, and security recommendations.

item.title: Android App Protection Policy Settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the app protection policy settings for Android devices.

item.title: Manage Microsoft Edge on iOS and Android With Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Microsoft Edge for iOS and Android to ensure corporate websites are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: Secure Your Corporate Data in Intune with Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Secure your corporate data in Microsoft Intune with Microsoft Edge for Business across all platforms.

item.title: Set permissions to Managed Home Screen using Android Enterprise OEMConfig - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add the Samsung Knox Service Plugin, Zebra OEMConfig Powered by MX, and Legacy Zebra OEMConfig apps to Intune, and use the app schemas to configure permissions for the Managed Home Screen (MHS) app on Android Enterprise devices.

item.title: Cloud PKI CA Expiration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to renew a certificate authority (CA) in Microsoft Cloud PKI to maintain continuous certificate issuance.

item.title: Creating elevation rules with Endpoint Privilege Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View guidance on how to create strong file elevation rules with Microsoft Intune Endpoint Privilege Management

item.title: Deploy Windows Update Packages in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to deploy a Windows update package (.msu file) in Intune.

item.title: Device Scopes in endpoint analytics - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use device scopes in Microsoft Intune endpoint analytics with scope tags for custom device reporting and targeted insights.

item.title: Role-based access control (RBAC) with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how RBAC lets you control who can perform actions and make changes in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune Management Extension - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Add Microsoft 365 Apps to Windows Devices Using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to install Microsoft 365 apps on Windows devices.

item.title: Troubleshoot Win32 Apps in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the most common methods to troubleshoot Win32 app issues with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Windows App Deployment by Using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Windows app deployment scenarios available with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manually Add the Windows Company Portal App - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how your workforce can manually add the Windows Company Portal app to their PC from the Microsoft Store.

item.title: Data Protection for Windows MAM - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable protected MAM access to org data using Windows MAM.

item.title: Review App Protection Policy Logs - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes how to configure Intune app protection policy (APP) logs.

item.title: Create and Assign an App Protection Policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create and assign an app protection policy in Microsoft Intune to protect your organization's data. Get step-by-step guidance.

item.title: Prepare a Win32 App to Be Uploaded to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to prepare a Win32 app to be uploaded to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Win32 App Management in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to manage Win32 apps with Microsoft Intune. This article provides an overview of the Intune Win32 app delivery and management capabilities.

item.title: Add Apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add apps to Microsoft Intune so you can assign apps to users and devices. Intune supports a wide range of app types.

item.title: Add and Assign Win32 Apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add, assign, and manage Win32 apps with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Data Protection Framework Using App Protection Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how app protection policies ensure an organization's data remains safe or contained in a managed app, regardless of whether the device is enrolled.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Enterprise Application Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Enterprise App Management and the Enterprise App Catalog in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Discovered Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand details about the detected apps that Intune found on a device.

item.title: Add Microsoft Edge for Windows to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding Microsoft Edge for Windows to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add PowerShell Scripts to Windows Devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and run PowerShell scripts, assign the script policy to Microsoft Entra groups, and use reports to monitor the scripts. See the steps to delete scripts you add on Windows devices in Microsoft Intune. Read common issues and resolutions.

item.title: Onboard and Configure Devices with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint via Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune, including connecting the products, onboarding devices, and assigning policies for compliance and risk level assessment.

item.title: Bring your own certificate authority with Cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a Microsoft Cloud PKI BYOCA issuing CA in Intune and anchor it to an on-premises or private CA.

item.title: Microsoft Intune cloud PKI fundamentals - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes fundamentals for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Cloud PKI root and issuing CA for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure a root and issuing CA for the Microsoft Cloud PKI service.

item.title: Deployment models for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes the deployment options for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Audit logs for Microsoft Intune cloud PKI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get audit logs for Microsoft cloud public key infrastructure (PKI) activity in the admin center.

item.title: Use Intune Suite add-on capabilities - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune Suite unifies a series of mission-critical advanced endpoint management and security capabilities. The capabilities of the suite are integrated with Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Security across endpoint platforms for both cloud and on-premises co-managed devices.

item.title: Microsoft Cloud PKI for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: An overview of the Microsoft Cloud PKI service, available with Microsoft Intune Suite or as an Intune add-on.

item.title: Delete issued PKI certificates with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Delete certificates issued via Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Monitor issued PKI certificates with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor reports for certificates issued via Microsoft Intune cloud PKI.

item.title: Enable MDM automatic enrollment for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment for Windows devices joining or registering with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Set up automatic enrollment in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment of Windows devices that join or register with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll Android, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, Linux, macOS, and Windows devices in Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: Sign up or sign in to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to sign up for a Microsoft Intune subscription or sign in to start with your subscription.

item.title: Sign Up for Microsoft Intune Free Trial Setup Guide - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Sign up for a Microsoft Intune free trial and configure your tenant. Learn the setup process, prerequisites, and how to configure domain names. Start evaluating Intune today.

item.title: Set up Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 1 for deploying or setting up Intune. The starting point is to review supported configurations, sign up for the trial, configure the custom domain name, add users and groups to Intune, assign licenses to users, manage roles, grant admin permissions, and set the MDM authority.

item.title: How to Monitor App Protection Policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes how to monitor app protection policies in Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune Service Description - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune is a cloud-based service that helps you manage Windows, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android devices.

item.title: Tutorial - Configure Slack to Use Intune for EMM and App Configuration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this tutorial you will configure Slack to use Intune for EMM and app configuration.

item.title: Network endpoints for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review endpoints for Intune. This page lists IP addresses and port settings needed for proxy settings in your Intune deployments.

item.title: Step 3. Integrate Mobile Threat Defense for App Protection Policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 3. Integrate Mobile Threat Defense signals with Microsoft Edge for Business app protection policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Step 4. Create App Configuration Policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 4. Create app configuration policies for Microsoft Edge for Business across Windows, Android, and iOS platforms.

item.title: Step 1. Create Microsoft Entra Conditional Access with Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 1. Create Microsoft Entra Conditional Access with Microsoft Edge for Business.

item.title: Step 2. Create App Protection Policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 2. Create app protection policies for Microsoft Edge for Business across Windows, Android, and iOS platforms.

item.title: Step 5. Create Settings Catalog policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 5. Create Settings Catalog policies for Microsoft Edge for Business on Windows and macOS.

item.title: Step 6. Understand Microsoft Edge for Business End User Experience for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 6. Understand Microsoft Edge for Business end user experience Windows.

item.title: Step 7. Troubleshoot Microsoft Edge for Business Data Security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 7. Troubleshoot Microsoft Edge for Business corporate data security in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Move from Basic Mobility and Security to Intune-Migration Guide - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Follow this migration guide to move your mobile device management from Microsoft 365 Basic Mobility and Security to Intune. Includes policy mapping and license assignment steps.

item.title: Access requirements policy mapping from Basic Mobility and Security to Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: A detailed list of the policy map between Basic Mobility and Security access requirements and Intune.

item.title: Configurations policy mapping from Basic Mobility and Security to Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: A detailed list of the policy map between Basic Mobility and Security configurations and Intune.

item.title: Miscellaneous policy mapping from Basic Mobility and Security to Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: A detailed miscellaneous policy map between Basic Mobility and Security access requirements and Intune.

item.title: Route logs to Azure Monitor using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Diagnostics Settings to send audit logs and operational logs in Microsoft Intune to Azure Storage account, Event Hubs, or Log Analytics. Choose how long you want to keep the data, and see some estimated costs for different size tenants.

item.title: Get started with macOS endpoints - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Intune guide to set up and configure macOS devices from setup to creating policies and enrolling devices. You secure your corporate and organization-owned endpoints that are enrolled in Intune, and then deploy at scale with Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Send Custom Notifications - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune to create and send custom notifications to users of iOS/iPadOS and Android devices.

item.title: Send Email Notifications to Noncompliant Devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create notification templates and send email alerts to users with noncompliant devices in Microsoft Intune. Configure actions for noncompliance.

item.title: Enroll a Windows device - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll a Windows device into Microsoft Intune. Follow this step-by-step evaluation guide to test device enrollment and verify it in the Intune admin center.

item.title: Add and Assign an App - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add and assign apps to user groups in Microsoft Intune. Ensure your workforce has access to the apps they need.

item.title: Create a user in Intune and assign a license - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create a user in Microsoft Intune and assign an Intune license to this user.

item.title: Try Microsoft Intune for free - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Evaluate Microsoft Intune with a free trial. Step through common settings, enroll devices, create policies, and learn about cloud-based device management. Start your trial today.

item.title: Create a Password Compliance Policy for Android Enterprise - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a password compliance policy in Microsoft Intune for Android Enterprise devices. Learn to require specific password lengths to meet your organization's security requirements.

item.title: Create an Email Device Profile for iOS/iPadOS Devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create an email device profile in Microsoft Intune for iOS/iPadOS devices. Configure email settings to help users securely access organization email.

item.title: Create and assign a custom role in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create and assign a custom Intune RBAC role with specific permissions for security operations. Follow this guide to implement least privilege access.

item.title: Create a Group to Manage Users - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create a group in Microsoft Intune and add users to the groups. Use groups to manage user access to company resources and assign policies.

item.title: Set up the Enrollment Status Page in the admin center copy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up a greeting page for users signing in and enrolling Windows devices copy.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Wipe - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to wipe, or factory reset, devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Intune for Device Compliance - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune as a Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) solution to enforce device compliance and prevent security breaches.

item.title: Prerequisites the Microsoft Tunnel VPN for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the prerequisites for installation and use of the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway. These include Linux servers, network, and firewall configurations.

item.title: Manage Apple Volume-Purchased Apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync apps you bought in volume through Apple Business Manager with Microsoft Intune. Then manage and track these apps on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Add an iOS/iPadOS Line-of-Business App to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about how to add an iOS/iPadOS line-of-business (LOB) app to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.
